artist: Artist: Utagawa Kunisada; Artist: Miyagi Gengyo; Publisher: Kagiya Shōbei
creditline: Gift of Arthur and Jane Pejsa
description: frowning man with eyes nearly crossed, wearing black and brown plaid and green striped garments; mounted on a thin sheet of paper which is mounted on a board
inscription: poem admiring the wrestler by the displayed acto
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Untitled actor series with wood tanzaku
signed: in toshidama cartouche: 豊國画 {Toyokuni ga} | {Gengyo sei} (produced by Gengyo) and seal on upper left
text: related to the play Sekitori nidai no shōbuzuke, performed at the Nakamura Theater, IX/1861
title: Actor Bandō Hikosaburō V as the Sumō Wrestler Onigatake Dōemon
